intro: Psephellus transcaucasicus, commonly known as the Transcaucasian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
